title: Meet Susana Clayton, the Joseph designer making the clothes we will want to wear next spring
text:
The frenzied reporting about the latest trend, scandal or next big thing that rumbles on throughout fashion month isn’t always compatible with the quest for classic investment pieces that many women are looking for.

They are there, “but often they’re hard to find,” says Susana Clayton, the recently appointed Lisbon-born creative director at Joseph, the much-loved label that presented its collection in Paris for the first time last week. “And they’re hard to design, because you have to find that juncture between timeless and modern.”

That already sounds like an oxymoron. “I know,” she laughs ruefully. “But that’s what I hope I’ve delivered at Joseph. They mustn’t be boring, but they mustn’t be...
